title: ASX loses 103 points over the session; Westpac, ANZ cut rates
text:
Lucas Baird

Losing almost 103 points, the S &P/ASX200 Index has completed its worst trading day since August 15 to end at 6,639.9 points, with nine companies out of ten finishing the session down.

Of these companies, Commonwealth Bank sunk the index the most with a 2.1 per cent decline in value to $79.60 a share. Moreover, National Australia Bank skidded 1.9 per cent to $29.02, Westpac dropped 1.7 per cent to $29.21, and Australia and New Zealand Bank fell 1.5 per cent to $28.05.

The banks wiped 29.6 points, collectively, from the index on Thursday. However, they were far from the only stocks having a miserable day.

Shares in mineral explorer BHP Group slid 1.9 per cent to $36.60, and those in biopharmaceutical firm CSL also dropped 1.6 per cent to $234.65.

On the other side of the ledger, the number of companies able to finish Wednesday up was just 19, and none were able to add a full point to the index individually.

But Mayne Pharma had the best day of the lot, increasing its value by 18.9 per cent in value to 63c. Northern Star Resources also had a positive day as shares in the company hiked 2.5 per cent to $11.29.
description: Australian shares had troubled day; iSignthis shares in shock suspension; Morgan Stanley says gold miner valuations are "stretched".
